fileIO
Class LEDataInputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      fileIO.LEDataInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
public class LEDataInputStream
extends java.io.InputStream

Little Endian Data Input Stream is used mainly for compatability with software written in other languages such as c++. This class is not safe for multithreaded access.

Constructor Summary
LEDataInputStream(java.io.InputStream is)
           
 
Method Summary
 int available()
           
 void close()
           
 void mark(int readLimit)
           
 boolean markSupported()
           
 int read()
           
 int read(byte[] bytes)
           
 double readDouble()
          Reads a little endian version of the 8 byte IEEE 754 type This method has been timed and executes an average of only 90% to 120% the time of its big endian counterpart.
 float readFloat()
          reads a little endian form of the 4 byte IEEE 754
 float readFloatBigEndian()
          Reads a 4 byte IEEE 754 float in big endian format This would be the same as the Java API's DataInputStream's readFloat
 int readInt()
           
 int readIntBigEndian()
          Reads a 4-byte int from big endian
 java.lang.String readLine()
          reads a line up to and including the next '\n' but will omit the '\n' from the result

readFloatBigEndian

public float readFloatBigEndian()
                         throws java.io.IOException
Reads a 4 byte IEEE 754 float in big endian format This would be the same as the Java API's DataInputStream's readFloat

java.io.IOException

readDouble

public double readDouble()
                  throws java.io.IOException
Reads a little endian version of the 8 byte IEEE 754 type This method has been timed and executes an average of only 90% to 120% the time of its big endian counterpart.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
